alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 11:44AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central San Diego County through 1230 PM PDT... At 1143 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southwestern Mount Laguna near Pine Valley. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Laguna, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, Pine Valley, Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna and Guatay. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Mountains
